key_title: Key to the subspecies of Olearia rugosa

Key to the species of Olearia

leads.lead_text: Leaves more than 2 times longer than wide, or if ever c. 2 times longer than wide then leaf base cuneate or attenuate; East and West Gippsland, and the Central Highlands
Leaves c. 2 (or less) times longer than wide; base cordate or sagittate, rarely truncate; Wilsons Promontory
Leaves more or less linear, largest leaves less than 15 mm wide; petiole less than 4.5 mm long; coastal areas of East Gippsland
Leaves ovate to obovate, elliptic or oblong, usually more than 15 mm wide; petioles more than 4.5 mm long; montane and foothill forest
Leaves oblong, obovate or elliptic, margins subentire or lobed in the distal half only; ranges east of the Snowy River
Leaves ovate to elliptic or suborbicular, margins lobed throughout or with only a few scattered lobes that are not restricted to the distal half; Central Highlands and South Gippsland
